page.title: 05Arts and crafts
page.content: The area is dominated by Lister Park and Cartwright Hall which is an art gallery and museum. Built 1904, the park and hall were originally the home of S C Lister (Lord Masham) 1815-1906 the textile magnate. The park was a bequest to the people of Bradford. Cartwright Hall is built in the Baroque style and is one of Bradford's most impressive buildings. The permanent collections consist of 19 & 20th century British art, including a notable collection of contemporary British prints. The museum receives 125,000 visitors each year. The hall stages about 30 exhibitions annually. A total of 8 galleries house the exhibitions (1200 sq metres) 3 galleries being reserved for permanent exhibitions. Local artists and textile designers are given ample opportunity to exhibit there.
